question: Amanda has 13 jars of chocolate chips in her cupboard. Each jar of chocolate chips can decorate 16 cookies. Amanda wants to bake enough cookies to use up all of her chocolate chips. If each tray holds 13 cookies, how many trays worth of cookies should she bake?
answer:
She has enough chocolate chips for 13 * 16 = <<13*16=208>>208 cookies.
She needs 208 / 13 = <<208/13=16>>16 trays to bake all of the cookies.
#### 16
